requirements.title: Admission Requirements
general: Parental consent and agreement to school policies
academic: Students are assessed based on academic readiness appropriate to their age/level
Previous academic performance is considered for transfer students
Assessment includes literacy, numeracy, and reasoning
behavioral: Students must demonstrate respect for authority and rules
Willingness to embrace Islamic values and school discipline
Good character references from previous schools

programs.name: Nursery
programs.description: Foundation years focusing on early development and Islamic values introduction

programs.name: Primary School
programs.description: Comprehensive Islamic and secular education from P1-P7

dayVsBoarding.title: Day vs Boarding

day.title: Day Section
day.description: Students attend during school hours and return home daily
day.ideal_for: Students with supportive home environments who prefer daily family contact

boarding.title: Boarding Section
boarding.description: Students reside on campus, experiencing immersive education and community
features: Structured daily routine including Islamic practices
boarding.ideal_for: Students seeking immersive education, those from distant areas, or those wanting intensive Islamic education

dayVsBoarding.note: Both sections maintain identical academic standards and curriculum. The choice depends on family circumstances and student needs.

admissionsLadder.title: Your Admissions Journey
admissionsLadder.subtitle: We guide you at every step. This is a conversation, not a hurdle.
admissionsLadder.message: You are supported at every step.

steps.title: Inquiry & Exploration
steps.description: Start by learning about Excel. Visit our campus, meet our team, ask questions. There's no pressure—just curiosity and exploration.
whatHappens: School tour with staff or current parents
Informal conversation about your family's goals

steps.title: Application & Assessment
steps.description: When you're ready, we'll get to know your child through a gentle assessment. This helps us understand their strengths and how we can best support them.
whatHappens: Simple application form about your family
Child's age-appropriate assessment (play-based for younger, academic for older)
Discussion of learning style and personality

steps.title: Placement Discussion
steps.description: Let's talk about which pathway fits your family best. We'll discuss day vs boarding, balanced track vs Qur'an focus, and any concerns you have.
whatHappens: Discussion of assessment results and child's readiness
Questions answered about expectations and support

steps.title: Enrollment & Preparation
steps.description: Once you've decided Excel is the right fit, we'll help you prepare. We provide checklists, schedules, and answer any last questions.
whatHappens: For boarding: family meeting about residential life
